name: Gift Certificate
description:
You want to get that special polish maker in your life a little something, but not sure what they'll like? Simple, give them a gift certificate! Select from values starting at $5. Click on "Buy Gift Certificate" to get started!

**Please do not add item to your cart, click on the "Buy Gift Certificate" button above to proceed with your gift certificate purchase**

How to redeem your gift certificate:

-Visit http://www.misfitson8th.com. Shop and find an item you wish to purchase. -Select PayPal as your payment option. Log in to your account. You must have or register for a PayPal account to redeem this gift certificate. (To register, click Sign Up now .) -When prompted, enter your gift certificate redemption code and follow the last steps to redeem your gift certificate. Now for the boring stuff: -Discount and/or sales promo cannot be used towards the purchase of a gift card. -Multiple gift certificates can be redeemed on a single purchase if they are in the same currency. Unused balances may be applied to other purchases. -Neither Misfits on 8th nor PayPal are responsible for lost or stolen gift certificates. -Your use of your gift certificate is subject to Paypal's terms and conditions. -All sales final. -No expiration date.

name: DIY Franken Polish Starter Kit
description:
Perfect for those interested in creating DIY custom polish. DIY Franken Polish Starter Kit includes;

1-2oz Suspension Base
4-Full size .5z/15ml empty bottles
4-Mini size 5ml empty bottles
16-Stainless steel mixing balls
14-Solvent resistant glitters , generous serving of 1 tsp
1-Funnel (not pictured)


Suspension Base is used for making nail polish with glitter, pigments and micas. Item is 3-Free which means:


NO Dibutyl Phthalate (DBP)
NO Toluene
NO Formaldehyde

The ingredients are:

Ethyl Acetate, Butyl Acetate, Nitrocellulose, Phthalic Anhydride/Trimellitic Anhydride/Glycols Copolymer, Isopropyl Alcohol, Sucrose Acetate Isobutyrate, Acrylates Copolymer, N-Butyl Alcohol, Stearalkonium Hectorite, Acetyl Tributyl Citrate, Camphor, Citric Acid, Benzophenone-1


Glitters
Each kit will come with a standard 8 solid colors, these are;

Aqua Teal Square .035
Black Square .035
Aqua Teal Hex .008
Azure Hex .008
Emerald Green Hex .008
Amber Hex .008
Black Multi -All black mix w/different shaped glitter
White Multi- All white mix w/different shaped glitter

In addition to the standard solids, you will then choose from options available of a pre-mixed variety. Each option has six glitter types, varying from colors, shapes & sizes.


If you want to select combos from different packs, please leave a note at checkout or convo me. Substitutions may occur.


These prices do not include shipping (listed separately). 

All sales final, no returns accepted. 

Suspension base is a flammable product and requires working in a properly ventilated area.You the buyer assume all risk & liability when purchasing this product.

name: Glow in the Dark - Summer Brights
description:
Glow in the Dark Powder Pigments for DIY Nail Polish. Keep in mind, just a little bit goes a long way with this product.

You can add this to only suspension base for a jelly-ish look, or add it to a suspension/white base combo for a more opaque look.

In the swatch pictures shown above, I mixed both suspension & white base with a pinch of the glow in the dark pigments to achieve the look. For a smooth finish I added a top coat, this does not affect the glow of the pigment , at all.

The color choices are;

Cherry Pie - Glows Whitish/Red
Lime Sorbert - Glows Green
Orange Sherbert - Glows Orange

As with glow in the dark products, charge under light for optimal brightness, please store product where light contact is minimal, and in a cool area. Please refer to the "Info & Safety Precautions" section regarding color changing pigments. 

Packaged by volume.

name: Solar/UV Pigments
description:
Solar UV Pigment for DIY Nail polish. Fun pigments that change color in the sun!
The pack & the individual colors are available in this listing. The colors in this pack are purple, red, and blue. Although they appear cloudy in the bottle (in shadow), these go on clear. The blue does have a slight green/yellow tint, however that is the nature of the pigment.

Picture #1 - Pigments in base, in shadow.
Picture #2 - Pigments in base, out in the sun. These have a jelly-ish finish.
Picture #3 - Bottle & swatch shot, out in the sun. This is after adding white base to the lacquer, it made it much more opaque.

These can be mixed with other colors for different effects, I suggest layering these over light colors for better results, if leaving it as a jelly.

These are not as concentrated as the other pigments I have available, and these do require a little more TLC in terms of dissolving the pigment into the base fully, you may need to add solvent as well. The sampler pack brings 4g of each pigment, total of 12 grams. See pricing for individual sizes available.

Please store product where light contact is minimal, and in a cool area. Please refer to the "About Us" section regarding color changing pigments.

Pigment is a fine powder. Please remember to use all safety precautions when handling pigment, and be sure to work in a properly ventilated area with appropriate safety wear.

Packaged by weight. All sales final.

name: Fleck Powder
description:
Solvent Resistant . This is a beautiful pigment/powder and a little goes a long way. I mixed 0.15g with suspension base , and even that was too much, but nonetheless I achieved beautiful results. In the third picture above, I swatched this on a clear nail, and over black polish for more detail. In the fourth swatch pictures, the purple neon pigment was used as a base (also available in the shop). Mix it with your favorite color, or just use it as a topper.


Your choice of;

-Blue
-Gold
-Green
-Purple

Swatches in the second and last pic are one coat over black creme polish. Pigment was mixed with suspensions base. For different effects you can also add white base to the mix! 

*Please excuse the polish spillage on some of the swatch sticks*

Pigment is a fine powder. Please remember to use all safety precautions when handling pigment, and be sure to work in a properly ventilated area with appropriate safety wear.

Packaged by volume.

name: Space Dust Pigments for DIY Polish
description:
Space Dust pigments. These pigments are quite concentrated/highly pigmented. A little goes a long way. As an example, a 0.15g of pigment is enough to color a 15ml bottle. However, you can always add more for your desired effect.

Your choice of;

-Blue
-Gold
-Green
-Red

Swatches above are one coat over black creme polish. Pigment was mixed with suspension base, and I feel even a 0.15g scoop was too much as the pigment appears "packed" on the swatches above. For a sparser look, use less pigment. For different effects you can also add white base to the mix! 

*Please excuse the polish spillage on some of the swatch sticks*

Pigment is a fine powder. Please remember to use all safety precautions when handling pigment, and be sure to work in a properly ventilated area with appropriate safety wear.

Packaged by volume.

name: Pearlescent Pigments for DIY Polish
description:
Pearlescent pigments. These pigments are quite concentrated/highly pigmented. A little goes a long way. As an example, a 0.15g of pigment is enough to color a 15ml bottle. However, you can always add more for your desired effect.

Your choice of;

-Blue
-Bronze
-Gold
-Green
-Pink (Duo-color, shifts to blue)
-Purple

Swatches above are two-coats on a clear nail stick. Pigment was mixed with suspensions base. For different effects you can also add white base to the mix! Listing is for 3g.

*Please excuse the polish spillage on some of the swatch sticks*

Pigment is a fine powder. Please remember to use all safety precautions when handling pigment, and be sure to work in a properly ventilated area with appropriate safety wear.

Packaged by volume.

description:
Glow in the Dark Powder Pigments for DIY Nail Polish. Keep in mind, just a little bit goes a long way with this product.

You can add this to only suspension base for a jelly-ish look, or add it to a suspension/white base combo for a more opaque look.

For a smooth finish I added a top coat, this does not affect the glow of the pigment , at all.

The color choices are;

Silver- Glows Teal/Blue'ish

Although the 3rd picture is blurry, I added it because it picked up the glow of eggplant better than in the other pic.

As with glow in the dark products, charge under light for optimal brightness, please store product where light contact is minimal, and in a cool area. Please refer to the "Info & Safety Precautions" section regarding color changing pigments.

description:
Glow in the Dark Powder Pigments for DIY Nail Polish. Keep in mind, just a little bit goes a long way with this product.

You can add this to only suspension base for a jelly-ish look, or add it to a suspension/white base combo for a more opaque look.

In the swatch pictures shown above, I mixed both suspension & white base with a pinch of the glow in the dark pigments to achieve the look. For a smooth finish I added a top coat, this does not affect the glow of the pigment , at all.

name: Neon Pigments for DIY Nail Polish
description:
Neon Pigments, black-light reactive for DIY Nail Polish. Keep in mind, just a little bit goes a long way with this product. These are very HIGHLY pigmented.

You can add this to only suspension base for a jelly-ish look, or add it to a suspension/white base combo for a more opaque look.

In the swatch pictures shown above, I mixed both suspension & white base with a pinch of the pink neon pigment to achieve the look. For a smooth finish add a top coat. Because these are very pigmented I recommend using a base coat, I haven't had issues with staining, but just mentioning it as a preventative measure.

The color choices are;

Orange
Green
Yellow
Red Coral
Pink

Please be sure to store product where light contact is minimal.

Pigment is a fine powder. Please remember to use all safety precautions when handling pigment, and be sure to work in a properly ventilated area with appropriate safety wear.

Packaged by volume. 

If you have not used these pigments before, please start off with a sample before committing to a larger size.
